name: packaging glass factory construction | packaging glass factory | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7340/documentation

This dataset represents the infrastructure of an average packaging glass production plant from occupied and unoccupied land with an annual production of 266 kt packaging glass.; It includes construction and dismatling of the different buildings and technical equipment, transport of technical equipment to the factory, land use, emissions and wastes from the replacement of the refractory material inside the furnace. Data are based on information of experts from a European container glass producer. The functional unit is 1 tonne of packaging glass per year.;The different parts of the packaging glass production plant considered in this dataset are as follow:;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From unoccupied and occupied industrial land forseen for the packaging glass factory.

This activity ends with the dismanteling of the buildings. The dataset includes the land-use, the construction and dismantling of the buildings, the construction and dismanteling of technical equipment (3 melting furnaces, 3 forming machines, 3 cooling furnaces), the construction of street and parking surface, the transport of the technical equipment to the glass production site, the emissions and wastes from the replacement of the refractory material inside the furnace. The dataset doesn't include emissions and wastes from the production process.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: european production site, based on personal communication from experts of a European packaging glass producer
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Based on information from experts and literature sources the following technology was considered:;;- annual production of 266 kt;;- specific land-use of 0.81 m2 per tonne and year;;;- life-time of buildings, street and parking surface of 50 years;;- buildings include production and storage facilites (80%), administration (10%), internal streets and parking areas (10%);- construction and dismanteling time of 1 year each;;- technical material comprising 3 melting furnaces, 3 forming machines, and 3 cooling furnaces. For all three machines, a foundation out of concrete was assumed with a life-time of 50 years.;;Based on information from literature source and from experts the following technical materials were considered:;- Melting furnace: made out of steel (11.5%), refractory material (88%), and electronics (0.5%). Total weight of 3â€™400 t. Life time of 25 years. Refractory material's life time of 10 years. Energy consumption for construction of 12.5 MJ per kg of steel is assumed; 45% from oil, 45% from gas, and 10% from electricity. For the dismanteling, all metals go to recycling while electronic installations are disposed.;- Forming machine: made out of steel (50%), iron (47.5%), and electronics (2.5%). Total weight of 45 t. Life time of 20 years. Forming moulds (100% iron) with a life time of 1 day. Energy consumption for construction of 12.5 MJ per kg of steel is assumed; 45% from oil, 45% from gas, and 10% from electricity. For the dismanteling, all metals go to recycling while electronic installations are disposed.;- Cooling furnace: made out of chromium steel (85%), isolation material (12.5%), and electronics (2.5%). Total weight of 80 t. Life time of 25 years. Energy consumption for construction of 12.5 MJ per kg of steel is assumed; 45% from oil, 45% from gas, and 10% from electricity. For the dismanteling, all metals go to recycling while electronic installations are disposed.;Reference:;European Commission (2000) Integrated Pollution Prevention and Control (IPPC) - Reference Document on Best Available Techniques in the Glass Manu-facturing Industry. Institute for Prospective Technological Studies, Sevilla

exchanges.description: Calculated value: based on literature sources and information from specialists, the amount of electronics in the technical material is as follow. Melting furnace: 0.5% w/w; Forming machine: 2.5% w/w; Forming mould: 0%; Cooling furnace: 2.5% w/w. All electronics are disposed.

exchanges.description: Estimation: based on information from experts, for all three machines (melting furnace, forming machine, cooling machine), a foundation out of concrete, weighting about 50% of the total weight of the machine is assumed. Its life-time is assumed to be 50 years, the same as the packaging glass factory. At the end of the life, it is assumed that 50% of this foundation is recycled while the remaining 50% are going to final disposal.
